result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brett Patrick Ewaldt

records.addlTxt: SYSTEM WILL NOT LET THIS EVENT BE DELETED.  THIS IS IN REGARDS TO THE 5/5/2022 DEFERRED AGREEMENT EVENT ENTERED ONLY.

09:17 AM Called 22CF19 for PLEAH.  Defendant, Brett Patrick Ewaldt, appeared in person with Attorney Chris A Gramstrup by video.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State in person.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Gramstrup, def to plead to amended count 1 maintain drug trafficking place, then DJOC which has been signed and filed.  Court reviews definition of DJOC.  Court reviews PLQ, and def confirms that is his signature.  Court reviews def's right to have all parties appear in person, def waives right for attny to appear in person. 
State makes Formal motion to amend count 1, Court grants motion. 
Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Def signed PLQ and DJOC.  Court reviews Defs constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Attny Gramstrup confirms the court may use the PC section of the criminal complaint on a factual basis.  Court asks for plea. 
Def enters a plea of Guilty to amended count 1 Maintaining a Drug Trafficking Place.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of amended count 1 Maintaining a Drug Trafficking Place, counts 2 & 3 are DRI and orders a JOC.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept DJOC agreement.  Def does not make a statement to the Court.  

Court finds this agreement appropriate, DJOC to run for 36 months, and reviews conditions with def.  Court will adopt agreement.
ENTERED IN ERROR, NOT ACTUALLY ENTERED INTO DEFERRED AGREEMENT YET.

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on May 16, 2022 at 09:15 am.

03:19 PM Called 22CF19. Defendant, Brett Patrick Ewaldt, appeared in person with Attorney Chris A Gramstrup by video.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State in person.  Attny Gramstrup confirms WOPH. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Discussion. Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information electronically, mirrors the criminal complaint.  State has had extensive discussion with Attny Gramstrup, likely close to settled.   Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all 3 counts.  Attny Gramstrup updates the court, likely resolved with a joint recommendation and DJOC.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 09:15 am.
